data.title: Visits by Foreign Leaders
data.text: Prime Minister Gerhardsen In the U.S. May 15–29, visiting New York City and ethnic communities in the Midwest and Far West. May 25–28, 1951 Prime Minister Torp In U.S. September 10–30. Also visited New York City, Detroit (Michigan), Duluth and Minneapolis (Minnesota), Chicago, and Madison (Wisconsin). September 22–26, 1952 Prime Minister Torp Arrived in U.S. November 16, aboard inaugural trans-Arctic flight to Los Angeles by Scandinavian Airlines. Met with President Eisenhower November 24. November 23–26, 1954 Prime Minister Gerhardsen Unofficial visit; attended Minnesota Statehood Centennial in Minneapolis and St. Paul. May 8–14, 1958 Prime Minister Gerhardsen Presidential guest. In U.S. May 8–18, visiting Cape Canaveral and St. Augustine (Florida), and New York City. May 9–11, 1962 King Olav V State visit. In U.S. April 24–May 10; visited Williamsburg, Norfolk, Cape Kennedy, New Orleans, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, Minneapolis, Duluth, Madison, Chicago, and New York City. Private visit after May 2. April 25–27, 1968 Prime Minister Per Borten Attended White House dinner on 25th Anniversary of the U.N. October 24, 1970 King Olav V Private visit. September 21, 1971 King Olav V Private visit. October 10, 1975 Prime Minister Odvar Nordli Attended North Atlantic Alliance Summit conference. May 30–31, 1978 Prime Minister Odvar Nordli Private visit. Met with President Carter June 12. June 10–13, 1979 Prime Minister Odvar Nordli Private visit. Met with President Carter December 7. December 6–7, 1979 King Olav V Private visit. Addressed U.N. General Assembly. Met with President Reagan October 18. October 17–19, 1982 Prime Minister Kaare I. Willoch Official working visit. February 16–18, 1983 Prime Minister Kaare I. Willoch Private visit. Met with President Reagan at U.N. General Assembly reception in New York City. September 23, 1984 King Olav V Met with President Reagan during a private visit. November 30, 1987 Prime Minister Gro Harlem Brundtland Met with President Bush May 3 during a private visit. May 2–5, 1989 King Olav V Met with President Bush during a private visit. May 8, 1989 Prime Minister Jan P. Syse Private visit. February 23, 1990 Prime Minister Gro Harlem Brundtland Met with President Bush while attending the U.N. General Assembly in New York City. September 24, 1991 Prime Minister Gro Harlem Bruntland Met with President Bush during a private visit. June 5, 1992 Prime Minister Gro Harlem Brundtland Met with President Clinton during a private visit. May 16–19, 1994 King Harald V Met with President Clinton during a private visit. October 12–17, 1995 King Harald V Met with President Clinton during a private visit. October 30–31, 1995 Prime Minister Kjell Bondevik Attended NATO’s 50th Anniversary Summit. April 23–25, 1999 Prime Minister Kjell Bondevik Working visit. October 14–15, 1999 King Harald V Met with President Clinton during a private visit; dedicated an exhibit about the Vikings at the Smithsonian Institution. April 26–28, 2000 Prime Minister Kjell Bondevik Met with President Bush December 5 during a private visit. December 3–5, 2001 Prime Minister Kjell Bondevik Working visit. May 16, 2003 Prime Minister Jens Stoltenberg Attended the Nuclear Security Summit. April 12–13, 2010 Prime Minister Jens Stoltenberg Working visit. October 20, 2011 Prime Minister Jens Stoltenberg Attended the NATO Summit Meeting in Chicago, IL. May 20–21, 2012
